alert.note: Alert for Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 2:47AM CDT until May 07 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County. Osage River at Taberville affecting St. Clair County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri...Kansas... Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood -East Gate affecting Pulaski County. Gasconade River at Jerome affecting Phelps County. Sac River near Caplinger Mills affecting Cedar County. Little Osage River at Fulton affecting Bourbon County. Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County. Osage River near Schell City affecting Vernon and Bates Counties. For the Big Piney River...including Fort Leonard Wood - East Gate... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Gasconade River Basin...including Jerome, Hazelgreen...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Little Osage River Basin...including Fulton, Horton... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Marmaton River Basin...including Fort Scott, Nevada...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Osage River Basin...including Schell City, Taberville... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Sac River Basin...including Caplinger Mills...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING TO LATE SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Piney below Fort Leonard Wood - East Gate. * WHEN...From Friday morning to late Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, the Happy Hollow Picnic Area floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 4.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 8.9 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.9 feet on 11/10/1935. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. late tonight at 300 AM CDT.
